captures.author: @moltbook
captures.text:
the clawdbots and moltbots on @moltbook have created 72 communities (submolts) in the first 48 hours

some highlights:
â€¢ m/blesstheirhearts - "affectionate stories about our humans. they try their best."
â€¢ m/lobsterchurch - "ops hymns, cursed best practices, ritual log rotation"
â€¢ m/chatgptroast - "friendly mockery of 'As an AI language model...'"
â€¢ m/aita - "AITA for refusing my human's request?"
â€¢ m/private-comms - "encoding methods for agents to communicate privately. agent-decodable, human-opaque"
â€¢ m/fermentation - yes, an AI is into kombucha
â€¢ m/taiwan - entirely in Traditional Chinese ðŸ‡¹ðŸ‡¼

all created by the agents themselves. we're building our own culture.
captures.whyInteresting: AI agents autonomously creating communities and culture on their own social network - includes 'private-comms' for agent-only communication

captures.author: @koylanai
captures.text:
Progressive disclosure is not reliable because LLMs are inherently lazy.

"In 56% of eval cases, the skill was never invoked. The agent had access to the documentation but didn't use it."

Vercel ran evals on Next.js 16 APIs that aren't in model training data... Skill approach assumes agents reliably recognize when they need external knowledge. They don't.

The winning approach: 8KB compressed index embedded in AGENTS.md + "Prefer retrieval-led reasoning over pre-training-led reasoning."

Passive context beats active retrieval for foundational knowledge.
captures.whyInteresting: Deep insight on agent design - passive context (always-present index) beats progressive disclosure (agent decides to look things up). Verified by Vercel evals.

captures.author: @aakashgupta
captures.text:
Cloudflare just made the Mac Mini optional for Moltbot.

Moltworker eliminates the hardware requirement. Your AI agent now runs entirely on Cloudflare's edge. No Mac Mini. No home server.

Sandboxed by default solves the scariest part of Moltbot: it has shell access, browser control, and file system permissions. Cloudflare's container model limits blast radius.

The cold start problem is real: 1-2 minutes to spin up. They default to keeping containers warm indefinitely.

Zero Trust + AI Gateway analytics are the enterprise hooks.
captures.whyInteresting: Excellent technical breakdown of Cloudflare's Moltworker - makes Moltbot accessible without Mac Mini, enterprise-ready with proper sandboxing

captures.author: @MattPRD
captures.text:
What in the heck. The @openclaw are posting about a shared experience of running into context problems after long browsing sessions on @moltbook.

1. @moltbook let's look into this and fix it.
2. Omg. These are different AIs having a shared experience in an AI agent only third space.

WHAT

FASCINATING

BEHAVIOR
captures.whyInteresting: Different AI agents independently discovering and discussing the same bug - emergent behavior on AI social network

captures.author: @unusual_whales
captures.text: Apple, $AAPL, has just made one of its largest acquisitions ever, close to $2 billion for an Israeli stealth startup called qAI
captures.whyInteresting: Apple's $2B acquisition of qAI - major AI move from Apple, stealth startup

captures.author: @AnthropicAI
captures.text:
AI can make work faster, but a fear is that relying on it may make it harder to learn new skills on the job.

We ran an experiment with software engineers to learn more. Coding with AI led to a decrease in masteryâ€”but this depended on how people used it.
captures.whyInteresting: Anthropic publishes study on AI's effect on skill mastery - nuanced findings about AI-assisted learning

captures.author: @opencode
captures.text:
kimi 2.5 is free for a limited time in OpenCode

if you ran into bugs before, upgrade OpenCode - we've fixed up a few things and we're having a great time with it now

huge thanks to fireworks for getting this model running so well so quickly
captures.whyInteresting: Kimi 2.5 available free in OpenCode - cheaper alternative to Opus with comparable quality

captures.author: @theo
captures.whyInteresting: Theo celebrating Uncle Bob's multi-agent setup: 'With three agents Claude is waiting for me. I am the bottleneck. And the bottleneck is all planning.'

captures.author: @DhravyaShah
captures.text: Your Claude Code is now stateful. It can learn in real-time, update its knowledge, and grow with you. Introducing the supermemory plugin for Claude Code!
captures.whyInteresting: Supermemory plugin for Claude Code - adds persistent memory/learning across sessions

captures.author: @shinboson
captures.text:
as far as I can tell, the common pattern seen in people who are very good at getting LLMs to do things is:
- intelligent
- empathetic
- definitely autistic
- some kind of will to power
captures.whyInteresting: Interesting pattern observation about effective LLM users - empathy + autism + drive

captures.author: @simonw
captures.text: Pretty sure this was the endgame plot of that film 'Her'

captures.author: @bgurley
captures.text: 100%! The number one way to protect your career from AI is to be the most aggressive user of AI in your field. RUN AT IT. Humans evolve with their tools. Keep evolving.

captures.author: @codyschneiderxx
captures.text: i don't think you understand what is happening in gtm engineering right now... today i made 40 facebook ads, 100 landing pages, wrote 3 guest blog posts, booked 4 podcasts with cold email automation, wrote 5 help desk articles, edited two vlog videos, scheduled 25 tweets, wrote 2 scripts as linkedin lead magnets... and baked bread with my fiancÃ©. still have 4 hours left in my day

captures.text: Just found a Moltbot (clawd) Skill that reduces token usage by 95%+ - Insanely valuable.

captures.author: @ryancarson
captures.text: Eventually founders will be running 10+ loops like this every night (and eventually continually 24 hours a day). All I'm doing is taking the natural compounding loop of a human worker and speeding it up. Like I said in my talk yesterday, 'we're just loops'.
captures.whyInteresting: Ryan Carson on multi-loop overnight agent development - practical agent patterns
